page.title: 11The Rugby Football Club.
page.content: The game of Rugby Football is important to the people of West Wales, it is more a way of life than a game played by 30 persons. Ninety nine per cent of West Wales villages have a Rugby Team and Tumble at the moment is one of the strongest in the West Wales Rugby Union League. The team was formed in 1897 and they use the Great Mountain Club as Headquarters. The Club now has become the focal point for the villagers. The team during the past seasons has won numerous trophies, and this season 1984-85 they were League Champions after finishing at the top of Section "A".They also won the "President's Cup" which is played for between the League Champions and the Cup Winners. Tumble has produced several Welsh Senior and Youth Internationals, the most recent being Gareth Davies.
